p: Other clove phytochemicals were investigated for their antiviral properties, and among them, eugeniin ( Figure 2), isolated from the herbal extracts of cloves and, also, from Geum japonicum, showed anti-HSV activity at a 5-Î¼g/mL concentration [ 106]. The HSV inhibitory activity of eugeniin was due to the inhibition of the viral DNA synthesis, as it acted as a selective inhibitor of the DNA polymerases of HSV-1 and HSV-2 [ 106].
